channel.title: MINA Refuses to Unbind
channel.description:
Well, as said in title, MINA refuses to unbind from the ports I bind it to once the application comes to a halt.
It annoys me when I am trying to debug a bug in my application, and I have to relaunch the application. When I relaunch the application 75% of the time it fails to bind to the port, even though I know for sure no other application is running on that port.
I'm using Linux Ubuntu as my operating system to develop, and the actual production server will be running on Linux CentOS. This seems to only happen on Linux, not Windows, but it is crucial that it has to work on Linux...
Any advice?
NOTE: After about a minute of doing nothing, the port unbinds itself.

item.title: MINA Refuses to Unbind
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:11, topic:414970”]It’s a Linux problem, or a problem with the JVM on Linux. The port will eventually become unbound on its own (when the kernel decides to mark it as so) but sometimes it can take a couple minutes before this happens. It makes server development on GNU/Linux very annoying. I’ve tried googling it and found no solutions, there’s not much anyone can do about it.

It’s happened with java.net, java.nio, MINA, and Netty for me.[/quote]

http://www.unixguide.net/network/socketfaq/2.7.shtml
http://www.unixguide.net/network/socketfaq/4.5.shtml

stackoverflow.com

Using SO_REUSEADDR - What happens to previously open socket?

c, network-programming, unix
asked by Naren on 04:05AM - 22 Apr 09

It’s both intentional and avoidable behavior.

item.title: MINA Refuses to Unbind
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you are sure all of the java processes are ended (killall java, but be careful about eclipse), then you should add code in your Java application to cleanly shut down and stop MINA when the application ends:
http://download.oracle.com/javase/1,5,0/docs/api/java/lang/Runtime.html#addShutdownHook(java.lang.Thread)

item.title: MINA Refuses to Unbind
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“veer, post:7, topic:414970”]Are you behind a firewall of some sort? Perhaps it’s really unresponsive.
Note: By firewall I mean NAT gateways as well.[/quote]
No firewall at all, but I’d have to agree, something is being unresponsive. If it helps, i’m using a TCP connection. As I said, this only happens on Linux, so i’m wondering what is causing it. (Ubuntu, Debian, and CentOS, all have the problem. Windows doesn’t.)

Pure Slay:

Sounds like you aren’t doing the networking correctly. Did you write it your self, or just using someone else’s.

I’m using an application that I created myself, but I don’t see any problem with how it does it’s networking. Most of it is based off MINA’s documentation.
